main_definition: The quality or state of being easily available, approachable, or usable.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ease of use for people with disabilities
meanings_and_examples.example: A public building has ramps and elevators to ensure its accessibility for wheelchair users.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Availability or ready access to resources, information, or services
meanings_and_examples.example: The library's online catalog is accessible 24/7, allowing anyone with an internet connection to search it at any time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ease of reaching a destination or attaining something desired
meanings_and_examples.example: He made the accessibility of quality education his top priority by opening more schools in rural areas.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The ability to connect and interact with others easily, often through technology
meanings_and_examples.example: Social media platforms enhance the accessibility between people from different parts of the world.
